Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11-19, Lisson Grove, Marylebone, London

item.title: Youths on top of container, 14th October
item.description:
Every afternoon up to five youths layabout on top of a container situated in Kings Meadow. 1/ Anyone of them could fall and injure themselves. I believe the council would be liable. 2/ They have a clear view into the rear of the houses of Hilldrop road. Invasion of privacy and potential security risk. 3/ It's intimidating to users of the park. 4/ Why is the container there in the first place. Could it not be removed altogether.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burnt Ash Lane, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish by bus stop, 14th October
item.description:
Rubbish always here as there is no bin, and the public are fly tipping
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bedonwell Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scattered rubbish by Snowsfields Primary School, 14th October
item.description:
Some black bin bags were dumped by the Guinness Trust’s bins located near the school’s entrance. The bags were ripped and the rubbish is now scattered all around the pavement as seen on the photos. Some DIY materials were also thrown nearby. We would like the Guinness Trust bins to be moved from the school’s entrance and placed on the housing estate site. This is a health hazard for our pupils.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kirby Grove, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road needs resurfacing, 14th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Appledore Close, London

item.title: Toilet chair left outside 141/139 Landells Road, 14th October
item.description:
It has been here for a week or two now. It has slowly been moved up and down the road and has ended up near my house now. I'm not sure if anyone has reported it but I thought I should.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 137, Landells Road, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Household and building materials being flytipped, 14th October
item.description:
This is an ongoing situation with household items and building materials being dumped at the communal area of the building. They are doing a refurshibment on a privately owned flat at number 10 knighthouse. The rubbish is becoming a major issue in the estate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Huntsman Street, Walworth, London

item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping, 14th October
item.description:
Old street door, fridge & chest of drawers have all been dumped in the alley along with bags of household waste. The area was only cleared about two weeks ago. This alley is constantly being used as a dumping ground. Area should be monitored as this is happening quite regularly & is a continual nuisance for residents & for pedestrians who use the alley.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clevedon Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
